snippet: A show of unity between rival Palestinian factions posed a diplomatic quandary for the United States, which considers Hamas a terrorist organization.
abstract: Hundreds of thousands of Palestinians pour into streets of Gaza City to celebrate anniversary of Fatah faction, in the heartland of its militant Islamist rival, Hamas; demonstration is latest in series of signals heralding possible reconciliation between the parties after bitter five-year rift.

byline.contributor: Abeer Ayyoub contributed reporting from Gaza City, and Fares Akram from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Wire service reports also contributed.

lead_paragraph: A show of unity between rival Palestinian factions posed a diplomatic quandary for the United States, which considers Hamas a terrorist organization.

headline.seo: Fatah Celebration in Gaza Signals Easing of Rift With Hamas
headline.main: Rally Signals Fatah’s Rift With Hamas May Ease
headline.print_headline: Rally in Gaza Hailing Fatah May Ease Rift
